author: Noel Hardin
title: Spring Garden librarian nominated for Librarian of the Year, wins Northwest District title | News | kq2.com
text:
(ST. JOSEPH, Mo.) A librarian at Spring Garden Middle School has recently been named the Northwest Region Missouri Association of School Librarians Librarian of the Year.
Lindsay Holland loves reading, books, and helping kids learn, so becoming a librarian for her was an easy choice.
Since joining Spring Garden Middle School 6 years ago, Holland has worked hard to make her library a safe place for all of her students, while giving them incentives to learn.
"Our library is just a gathering place. It's a place for students to come and feel like they belong. We do a lot of clubs in the mornings. We have Chess Club, we have Rubix Club, we have the Sports Card Trading Club. So I think it's kind of a community space where everyone can kind of walk in as equals." Said Holland.
Holland's impact on her students' lives is felt even after they leave middle school, with her stating that she has former students recognize her and share how their lives are going even after graduating.
"It's so sweet to watch them grow up. And they'll be like, 'oh, I loved you so much.' I'm like, 'oh, you were so ornery. But yes, I loved you too, and I'm glad you're doing well.'"
Her efforts came into fruition this year when she was named the Northwest Regional Librarian of the Year, a nationwide competition that recognizes great teachers and their efforts to make learning fun and efficient.
"The president of our region nominated me for the Regional Librarian of the year. And then that goes on. There's 11 regions, so it'll go on to semi finalists sometime in the winter, whenever their winter meeting is, and then at our big state convention, they'll have three that they choose from."
And she says that she is truly humbled by the nomination.
"I have the best job ever. So it's just another awesome thing to have happen. It's an honor. It was a big surprise. They really got me. I still can't believe I got it, but I'm very honored."
Holland's next steps are to complete her paper on School Librarian of the Year at the state level, and if she advances to the nationwide level, then she will then show off her skills among the best of the best.

author: /author/ians/
title: Producers Richa Chadha, Ali Fazal's 'Secrets of a Mountain Serpent' set for Venice premiere
text:
Producers Richa Chadha, Ali Fazal’s ‘Secrets of a Mountain Serpent’ set for Venice premiere
By IANS | Updated: July 24, 2025 09:04 IST2025-07-24T08:56:36+5:302025-07-24T09:04:35+5:30
Mumbai, July 24 Star couple Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal’s film ‘Secrets of a Mountain Serpent' produced under ...
Mumbai, July 24 Star couple Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal’s film ‘Secrets of a Mountain Serpent' produced under their banner Pushing Buttons Studios is all set to have its premiere at the Venice Film Festival.
“Secrets of a Mountain Serpent” is directed by Nidhi Saxena, whose debut feature, Sad Letters of an Imaginary Woman premiered at the 2024 Busan International Film Festival to great acclaim, is the first Indian woman to win the Biennale College Fund grant for Secrets of a Mountain Serpent.
Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal said in a joint statement: "We were immediately drawn to Nidhi’s lyrical vision. This is a story rooted in myth and yet is startlingly relevant today. At
PBS, we believe in backing storytellers who take creative risks and Nidhi has crafted something singular, poetic, and soulful."
Set in a remote Himalayan town during the 1990s, ‘Secrets of a Mountain Serpent’ tells the intimate story of Barkha played by Trimala Adhikari, a schoolteacher whose husband is posted at the border.
In a place where most men are gone and days echo with silence, Barkha finds herself drawn to Manik Guho, played by Adil Hussain, a mysterious outsider who disrupts the fragile balance of waiting, restraint, and myth.
Saxena, who also wrote the film, welcomed the new creative partnership and said the film is about women who chose to risk everything and follow their desires, shedding the burden of moralities imposed upon them by the world.
The director added: “I was looking for kindred collaborators and this feels like a meeting of minds and hearts. It also feels like we no longer need to borrow men’s voices to tell our stories. We have our own voice, which is strong, with femininity”.
Secrets of a Mountain Serpent has recently completed principal photography and is currently in post-production. It will have its world premiere at the Venice Film Festival in August 2025.
Disclaimer: This post has been auto-published from an agency feed without any modifications to the text and has not been reviewed by an editor

author: Devon Lucie
title: Excessive heat and a possible Gulf storm. Likeliest track, here:
text:
Excessive heat and keeping close watch on the gulf in your New Orleans weather forecast
Dangerous heat gets even hotter and keeping close watch on a possible tropical system expected to develop in the Gulf of Mexico
Dangerous heat gets even hotter and keeping close watch on a possible tropical system expected to develop in the Gulf of Mexico
Dangerous heat gets even hotter and keeping close watch on a possible tropical system expected to develop in the Gulf of Mexico
Dangerous heat gets even worse and keeping a very sharp eye on a possible hurricane in the Gulf of Mexico in your New Orleans weather forecast.
For an in depth discussion on the system expected to move into the gulf,
click here.
LOCAL FORECAST:
Heat is still our biggest concern for Southeast Louisiana as the heat only intensifies as we heat into the weekend.
Morning temps are ticking up too. Many of us might not drop below 80, and for those that do we might only realize the 70s for an hour or two.
The heat intensifies on Friday where we are under an Excessive Heat Warning. That makes it a WDSU First Warning Weather Alert Day for temperatures that could feel as hot as 115!
There is a small chance, 20%, that we find an isolated shower/storms or two.
I'm expecting just as hot of a day on Saturday, possibly even a bit hotter. However, a front that's nearing the region is forecast to spark scattered storms that could provide some temporary relief.
I've hot high temperatures still around 97 in New Orleans, so I expect more heat alerts and at least a weather impact day.
Be sure to find a place to keep cool through this heat wave!
TROPICAL UPDATE:
The latest data is in from the National Hurricane Center (NHC) and a system we're montitoring very closely is still a large area of disorganized storm activity.
There is now a moderate chance (40%) of tropical development within the next 2 days, but it's a much better chance the system devlops into a tropical depression over the weekend where theres a 70% chance of formation.
Forecast data is now coming in guiding us on its most likely track and how strong it might become. The Bermuda high looks like it will start to track the system north just off the west coast of Florida and become our 4th named storm of the season, Debby.
We will be watching this system every step of the way and provide you with the best information as it evolves.
SEVEN DAY FORECAST:
I don't see the heat subsiding any time soon. We might get "slightly" cooler Sunday and Monday, but only by a degree or two.
- Devon

author: @marieclairearg
title: El look favorito de Hailey Bieber esta inspirado en la princesa Diana, conjunto de 3 piezas que es facil de replicar | Marie Claire
text:
No se puede negar: Hailey Bieber es una de las chicas “It” de la moda de esta era. Su estilo casual de chica cool está lleno de gorras de béisbol, siluetas holgadas y camisetas sin mangas mini, y nos inspira con cada look. Cada pieza es fácil de imitar, lo que hace que los looks de Bieber sean más accesibles. El conjunto reciente de la modelo o unos de las últimos looks no fue diferente, ya que presentaba piezas cotidianas que se pueden usar una y otra vez .
El look de Hailey Bieber inspirado en Lady Di
La vimos paseando por los Ángeles y Bieber lució un conjunto aprobado por los fitness que incluía un buzo con capucha de gran tamaño con cremallera, mini shorts y zapatillas New Balance. Cada conjunto fue sencillo. De hecho, son tan buenos que es uno de sus favoritos porque los llevo en varias ocasiones y podes replicarlo con piezas de ropa que seguramente tengas en tu armario.
Estos looks casuales nos recuerdan instantáneamente la moda de la princesa Diana de los años 80, ya que las blusas de gran tamaño y los pantalones cortos diminutos crean el look deportivo definitivo. Esta tampoco es la primera vez que Bieber se inspira a la Princesa Lady Di , ya que usó variaciones de estos conjuntos en el pasado. La clave, es que las enormes sudaderas con capucha compensan perfectamente los pantalones pequeños, mientras que los zapatos gruesos realzan el estilo.
El estilo del buzo no solo recuerda a los gurús de la moda del pasado, sino que también es ideal para la primavera-verano. Además como este y el de Bieber se pueden usar una y otra vez, ya sea en casa o para salir.
Los zapatos New Balance de Haileu Bieber son también los zapatos de supermodelo para los paseos en la calle casuales. Todos, desde Emily Ratajkowski hasta Kendall Jenner, poseen un par de estas zapatillas y las usan repetidamente. La propia Bieber uso las zapatillas sin parar más allá de estas dos ocasiones, combinándolas con una chaqueta de cuero y calcetines más largos que las zapatillas.

author: @Our Correspondent
title: Minor boy killed as land grabbers attempt to scare police off in Scheme 45
text: A minor boy died and another was injured during a confrontation between police and protesters during an operation against land grabbers in Scheme 45 on Thursday. The area of Scheme 45 remained tense after the government institutions once again conducted the operation against the land mafia. Two children were severely injured in another episode of intense gunfire in the area. Both children were transported to hospital where one of them succumbed to his injuries. Once again, stones were thrown at government officials and machinery by the occupiers, leading to clashes with the police. The anti-encroachment operation was launched in different sectors of Scheme 45 by the Malir Development Authority. During the crackdown, the protesters pelted the operation team, including police and Rangers, with stones. The law enforcers, however, used teargas to disperse agitated protesters. The operation was conducted in different residential and commercial sectors, including residential sectors 11, 18, and 23 and commercial sectors 19 and 24. Police, Rangers, MDA, Anti-Encroachment Police, and Special Security Unit were part of the operation. According to District West SSP Mahzoor Ali, the situation was brought under control in the area, and illegal structures on the MDA’s land were demolished. As soon as the operation began, shots were fired at the police by agitated protesters. Four police armored vehicles were present on the front line, ensuring the safety of all officers. Police said that in response, the police only used shelling, and possibly one of the agitated protesters also fired at children. After intense chaos, the operation was halted. The injured children aged between nine and ten years were taken to Abbasi Shaheed Hospital where the nine-year-old boy succumbed to his injuries. The identities of the deceased and injured children are yet to be ascertained. The K-Electric will undertake a critical maintenance activity at Malir Grid on Friday to ensure the stability and... author: Bulawayo24 News
title: Fake Zimbabwe ID syndicate busted in Bulawayo
text:
News / National
Fake Zimbabwe ID syndicate busted in Bulawayo
50 mins ago | Views
A syndicate behind the production of fake national identity documents has been exposed at the Civil Registry Department's Tredgold building in Bulawayo, with links to a company contracted by the Department of Deeds, Companies and Intellectual Property.
The scam was uncovered after a vigilant Civil Registry official noticed irregularities during a routine application for a new plastic ID card. A woman, Ms Buhle Sibanda (born in 1995), had visited the registry offices accompanied by a man identified only as Brian.
While Ms Sibanda presented what appeared to be a legitimate paper copy of her ID, the official was alarmed to find that the photograph on the document was an exact match of the applicant's appearance on that very day - same clothes, hairstyle, and makeup. This raised suspicions, especially after Ms Sibanda insisted the document had been issued in 2019 and that she had merely kept a photocopy since then.
Further scrutiny of the document revealed additional discrepancies, including a reference to a non-existent traditional leader, "Chief Tshabanda" of Tsholotsho. There is no such chief in the district.
Under interrogation, Ms Sibanda eventually admitted that the photo had been taken that same day just outside the Tredgold building and that all processing had been handled by Brian.
Investigations have since confirmed that Brian is employed by Dokma Private Limited, a company currently contracted to the Department of Deeds, Companies and Intellectual Property. Dokma is involved in digitizing operations under the Deeds, Lands, and Administration Systems programme.
The matter is now under further investigation by authorities, with indications that this may be part of a wider fraudulent network exploiting access to sensitive government systems through private contractors. More arrests are expected as the probe expands.
Officials have urged members of the public to be cautious and report any suspicious activities related to identity documents.

Source - the chroncile

author: Diego Santiago Salinas Rodriguez
title: Andi frente a crisis de agua: soluciones basadas en la naturaleza se convierten en la mejor respuesta
text: Cabe recordar que el nivel de los embalses está en su momento más crítico debido a la escasez de lluvias por el fenómeno de El Niño. En el caso de Bogotá, el Sistema Chingaza es el más afectado, con alrededor del 16 por ciento de su capacidad. Los otros dos sistemas son los agregados Sur y Norte. Este último, si bien tiene un mejor nivel que Chingaza, viene en tendencia descendente. Ante la actual crisis por el agua, ciudadanos, algunas organizaciones y autoridades despertaron han propuesto medidas para preservar el agua. El Centro Nacional del Agua y la Biodiversidad, por ejemplo, hace un llamado para tomar acciones de prevención y adaptación.El programa propone crear una fuerte estrategia de prevención a la ciudadanía en escenarios de sequía como de inundaciones, ya que se aproxima el periodo de lluvias en la región. También promover la conciencia del cuidado y ahorro de agua. Además, advierte al Acueducto de Bogotá fortalecer el sistema Tibitoc, que es parte fundamental del ciclo hídrico al norte de la ciudad. Incluyendo fortalecer fuertemente la cuenca del río Bogotá para tratar las aguas lluvias e invertir en la naturaleza.La Andi ha implementado medidas dentro de su red de empresas para ayudar al cuidado del agua, a través de la economía circular en la que se reusan y recircula el líquido que se utiliza en las actividades diariamente. El programa ‘El agua nos une’, que apoya la restauración de parques naturales, entre ellos Chingaza, Guerrero y Sumapaz.La protección de los ecosistemas es también parte fundamental para adaptarse y combatir el cambio climático, por esto, la organización enfoca la importancia en el cuidado de los humedales, que funcionan como colchón de agua para la ciudad, y destaca su alianza con otras entidades ambientales para movilizar al sector empresarial en acciones e inversiones en seguridad hídrica y conectividad rural de la Sabana.Finalmente, la Asociación de Empresarios pone todo su concurso para ayudar a la mitigación del cambio climático en Bogotá.​
